Help Make A Difference: Donate Today to Support a Cure!
 

Every 23 seconds, someone is diagnosed with diabetes. Diabetes causes more deaths a year than breast cancer and AIDS combined. It must be stopped!

Your gift today will go a long way in helping us save lives and continue to lead the search for a cure, so that one day we can be free of diabetes and its burdens.

Make a Gift to Stop Diabetes® and Earn 1,000 Points

We’ve got a big problem–1 in 11 Americans already has diabetes and the diabetes epidemic is growing at a shocking rate. Someone gets diagnosed every 23 seconds and the disease can affect anyone, even the most health-conscious among us. Time is precious. We urgently need your support to strengthen prevention efforts and speed the search for better treatments and a cure.

Take your activism even further by making a secure, tax-deductible gift. Your generous support will go a long way in the fight for a cure and make a difference in the lives of all people affected by diabetes, helping to:

  • Advocate for diabetes research and programs, and for the rights of people living with diabetes;
  • Fund critical diabetes research;
  • Ensure that all people with diabetes get the best care, treatment and information about how to manage their disease;
  • Reach out to communities throughout the United States hit hardest by diabetes to raise awareness and provide resources. And so much more!

Help give the gift of diabetes summer camp to a child like yours.
 

Give a child living with diabetes the life-changing experience of spending a whole week having fun and learning how to better manage this tough disease with other kids who all have diabetes, too.

 

 It's tough to feel like you're the only person in the world who has to deal with diabetes, but then you go to camp. Camp is a place where I feel safe and people understand what I'm going through. When I'm there, everyone gets it, no one stares and there's no explanation necessary.

Today, 1 in 11 Americans is living with diabetes. Millions more are at high risk of developing diabetes. We must take bold action and increase our investment in diabetes research now to turn this tide. But with your support today, we can continue to fight back.

Honor a loved one you've lost by making a tax-deductible donation to advance critical diabetes research and support education, advocacy and awareness programs that improve the lives of people with diabetes.

When we receive your gift, a tree will be planted, to create a beautiful, living memorial to the person you've lost.

The trees which are planted in national forests that have been recently ravaged by wildfires or other natural disasters to restore life and balance to these damaged ecosystems. We are partnering with the Arbor Day Foundation, a respected not-for-profit conservation and education organization, to offer families touched by diabetes this meaningful way to honor their loved ones.

When you make a memorial donation to the American Diabetes Association, a tree will be planted in one of our nation’s forests in memory of the person you are honoring. The tree will be a living monument to your loved one.

Please use our Honor Donation Form to make a donation to honor someone you love. You can also make your donation by phone at 1-800-DIABETES (1-800-342-2383) or by mail.


*Image above provided by the Arbor day Foundation

Your Donations at Work

Keep working toward a cure

Your support helps fund active research projects working to find breakthroughs to cure, prevent and treat diabetes.

 

Fight for people with diabetes.

Your help gives strength to Diabetes Advocates fighting for the rights and safety of children and adults nationwide.

 

Improve lives.

Your commitment supports public awareness and education programs that help people with diabetes live healthier lives.

 

Let's end this crisis together. Donate today.

Camp: a magical place where kids with diabetes have FUN! Camp changes lives by connecting campers with other kids like them, sharing their highs and lows and learning how to better manage their diabetes – all in a safe environment surrounded by trained staff and medical professionals.

We serve 6,000 campers every summer but many of our summer camps are at capacity. We max out the number of campers we can accommodate each summer, leaving a long waiting list of kids who desperately want and need to attend.

Providing a wonderful summer camp experience for children with diabetes is just one of the ways we serve the diabetes community. Your donation also advances diabetes research to find new treatments and ultimately a cure, and improves the lives of everyone affected by diabetes.

Providing a wonderful summer camp experience for children with diabetes is just one of the ways we serve the diabetes community. Your donation also advances diabetes research to find new treatments and ultimately a cure, and improves the lives of everyone affected by diabetes.

Please use our Memorial Donation Form or Honor Donation Form to make a donation to honor someone you love or remember someone you've lost. You can also make your donation by phone at 1-800-DIABETES (1-800-342-2383) or by mail.

Why Camp Matters

A Chance to be a Kid

At camp, kids get to be kids. For many kids it’s the first time they aren’t the kid with diabetes. They can talk openly and freely about their struggles and everyone understands. They build friendships that last a lifetime.

 

Empowerment to Manage Diabetes

Camp teaches kids valuable lessons on how to manage diabetes. They check their sugar levels before and after activities, count carbohydrates at each meal and snack, and many are learn how to figure out the correct insulin dose and give themselves their first insulin injection or move their insulin pump site for the first time.

 

Build Confidence & Independence

For many kids, camp is the first time they have been away from their parents who help them manage their diabetes. Being away from home and tackling intimidating diabetes management challenges, campers gain self-confidence. They make new friends and try new sports and activities - all help build campers’ confidence and become more independent.

 

Please take a few moments to watch a short video about our camp program that serves 6,000 children every summer. Our campers have FUN while connecting with other kids like them, sharing their highs and lows and learning how to better manage their diabetes all in a safe environment surrounded by trained staff and medical professionals.

Providing a wonderful summer camp experience for children with diabetes is just one of the ways we serve the diabetes community. By donating today, you will also help us advance diabetes research to find new treatments and ultimately cure and improve the lives of everyone affected by diabetes.

Providing a wonderful summer camp experience for children with diabetes is just one of the ways we serve the diabetes community. By donating today, you will also help us advance diabetes research to find new treatments and ultimately cure and improve the lives of everyone affected by diabetes.

Please use our Memorial Donation Form or Honor Donation Form to make a donation to honor someone you love or remember someone you've lost. You can also make your donation by phone at 1-800-DIABETES (1-800-342-2383) or by mail.

In the next 48 hours, 7,670 Americans will be diagnosed with diabetes, changing their lives forever. There's no sugarcoating it–diabetes is bad news. It makes everything harder—from eating a meal to staying healthy to being treated fairly at work and school and so much more.

That's why we want to show these people that they're not alone during what is probably a very tough time in their lives. Show them that you stand with them by making a gift to help fight this devastating disease. No matter how much you’re able to give, your tax-deductible gift will help speed the search for a cure and improve care for people living with diabetes, as well as prevent more Americans from developing this deadly disease. #GiveForDiabetes

STANDING TOGETHER – OUR WONDERFUL SUPPORTERS

Fill out the fields to put your pin in the map!

 
*Not a realtime map

Today, 1 in 11 Americans has diabetes and millions more are at risk of developing the disease. Many people still underestimate how serious and deadly diabetes really is—it kills more people each year than breast cancer and AIDS combined, and it is the leading cause of blindness, kidney failure, and lower-limb amputations in adults. It also DOUBLES the risk of heart disease and stroke.

This Is Diabetes™. This is how you can help.

Donate today—your contribution will make a significant impact and save lives through research for better treatments and cures, education and tools to support people living with the disease and their families, and help us advocate for the rights and health of people with diabetes.

Our corporate partner, Nutrisystem, will match all gifts, dollar for dollar, up to a campaign total of $50,000, in honor of American Diabetes Month®, doubling your impact.

Don’t delay! This online matching gift expires on November 30.

Fill out the fields at left to make your secure, tax-deductible gift and have it doubled by Nutrisystem. #ThisIsDiabetes

Our corporate partner, Nutrisystem, will match all gifts, dollar for dollar, up to a campaign total of $50,000, in honor of American Diabetes Month®, doubling your impact.

Please use our Memorial Donation Form or Honor Donation Form to make a donation to honor someone you love or remember someone you've lost. You can also make your donation by phone at 1-800-DIABETES (1-800-342-2383) or by mail.

Credit Card Verification Code

The Verification Code is imprinted on credit cards to help merchants verify transactions when the actual card is not present, such as Internet purchases or donations. The merchant uses this number as part of the authorization process with the card issuer.

Please use the images below to locate the verification code for your card type.

Visa, Master Card, and Discover

The verification code for Visa, Master Card, and Discover is a 3-digit number printed on the back of your card. It appears after the account number or last 4-digits of your account number, in the signature panel.

 

American Express

The American Express verification code is a 4-digit number printed on the front of your card. It appears above and to the right of the embossed account number.

 

You are almost set!

Paypal payment type is not available for monthly gifts. Complete the credit card payment information and you are all set!
